session_info.title: 15-Minute HIIT Energy Booster
session_info.description: High-intensity interval training to boost energy, burn calories, and improve cardiovascular fitness

preparation.space: Area large enough to move freely in all directions
preparation.hydration: Have water nearby and drink throughout workout
preparation.clothing: Breathable, moisture-wicking athletic wear and supportive shoes
safety_notes: Stop immediately if you feel chest pain, severe shortness of breath, or dizziness
Modify exercises as needed for your fitness level
Form is more important than speed
Listen to your body and rest when needed

warm_up.purpose: Prepare muscles and cardiovascular system for high-intensity work

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Make large circles with arms, forward for 15 seconds, backward for 15 seconds.
exercises.benefits: Warms shoulder joints and upper body

exercises.name: Leg Swings
exercises.instructions: Hold wall or chair for balance. Swing one leg forward and back 10 times, then side to side 10 times. Switch legs.
exercises.benefits: Loosens hip joints and leg muscles

exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.instructions: Jump feet apart while raising arms overhead, then jump feet together while lowering arms. Maintain steady pace.
exercises.modifications: Step out to sides instead of jumping

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.instructions: March in place, bringing knees up toward chest as high as comfortable. Pump arms in running motion.
exercises.benefits: Raises heart rate, warms leg muscles

exercises.name: Burpees
exercises.instructions: Squat down, place hands on floor, jump back to plank, do push-up, jump feet back to squat, jump up with arms overhead.
modifications: Beginner: Step back to plank instead of jumping
Advanced: Add tuck jump at the top
No push-up: Skip the push-up portion
exercises.form_cues: Keep core tight, land softly, maintain control

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.instructions: Start in plank position. Quickly alternate bringing knees toward chest as if running in place.
modifications: Step knees in instead of jumping
exercises.form_cues: Keep hips level, hands directly under shoulders

exercises.name: Jump Squats
exercises.instructions: Squat down with weight in heels, then explode up into a jump. Land softly and immediately go into next squat.
exercises.form_cues: Chest up, knees track over toes, soft landing

exercises.name: Push-up to T
exercises.instructions: Do a push-up, then rotate to side plank position raising top arm to ceiling. Return to plank, repeat on other side.
exercises.form_cues: Straight line from head to heels, controlled rotation

exercises.name: Reverse Lunges
exercises.instructions: Step one foot back into lunge position, lower back knee toward ground, push through front heel to return. Alternate legs.
modifications: Hold wall or chair for balance
exercises.form_cues: Front knee over ankle, back knee toward floor

exercises.name: Plank Jacks
exercises.instructions: Hold plank position. Jump feet wide apart, then jump back together, like jumping jacks in plank position.
modifications: Step feet out instead of jumping
exercises.form_cues: Keep hips level, core engaged throughout

cool_down.purpose: Gradually lower heart rate and begin recovery process

exercises.name: Walking in Place
exercises.instructions: Walk slowly in place, gradually slowing pace. Raise arms overhead and bring them down slowly.
exercises.breathing: Deep, controlled breaths to normalize heart rate

exercises.name: Deep Breathing & Gentle Stretching
exercises.instructions: Place hands on chest and belly. Take slow, deep breaths. Gently roll shoulders and shake out arms and legs.
exercises.breathing: 4 counts in through nose, 4 counts out through mouth
exercises.purpose: Activate recovery response, begin muscle relaxation

post_workout.hydration: Drink water to replenish fluids lost through sweat
post_workout.nutrition: Consider a protein snack within 30 minutes if this was a morning workout
post_workout.recovery: Light stretching or walking throughout the day aids recovery
post_workout.progress_tracking: Note how you felt - energy level, which exercises were challenging

safety_reminders: This is a high-intensity workout - build up gradually
Stop if you feel chest pain, dizziness, or nausea
Proper form prevents injury - slow down if form breaks down
Stay hydrated before, during, and after workout
daily_tips: Aim for 2-3 HIIT sessions per week with rest days between
Combine with strength training and flexibility work for complete fitness
Track your progress - you'll be amazed how quickly you improve
Fuel your body with nutritious foods to support your active lifestyle
